jNetDev.Headers
Class jND_EthernetAddress

java.lang.Object
  jNetDev.Headers.jND_EthernetAddress

public class jND_EthernetAddress
extends java.lang.Object

jND_EthernetAddress
Class to model an Ethernet MAC address. One can think of this largely as a converter class. The constructors will make a jND_EthernetAddress out of a byte[] or a String or a jND_BYTE8. The toByteArray, toString and toByte8 methods to the inverse conversions.

In addition, the address() mutators allow one to change the underlying address after it is constructed.

Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

jND_EthernetAddress

public jND_EthernetAddress()
Default constructor: Constructs an 'empty' address which is equivalent to 00:00:00:00:00:00.

jND_EthernetAddress

public jND_EthernetAddress(byte[] mac)
                    throws jND_Exception
Construct an Ethernet address from a byte array. If the length of the array is not jND_EthernetAddress.ENET_ADDR_LEN an exception is thrown.

Parameters:
mac - - the byte array containing the address.
Throws:
jND_Exception

jND_EthernetAddress

public jND_EthernetAddress(java.lang.String hex)
                    throws jND_Exception
Construct an Ethernet address from a string. The format of the string is a sequence of 6, 2-digit hexadecimal numbers separated by colons or dashes. Thus, legal strings include aa:01:44:00:df:11 and 00-ba-d4-23-44-01. If the length of the address is not jND_EthernetAddress.ENET_ADDR_LEN an exception is thrown.

Parameters:
hex - - the string containing the address in hexadecimal.
Throws:
jND_Exception

jND_EthernetAddress

public jND_EthernetAddress(jND_BYTE8 mac)
Construct an Ethernet address from a 8-byte integer.

Parameters:
mac - - the 8-byte integer containing the address.

address

public void address(java.lang.String hex)
             throws jND_Exception
Mutate (change) the underlying address based on a string parameter. The format of the string is a sequence of 6, 2-digit hexadecimal numbers separated by colons or dashes. Thus, legal strings include aa:01:44:00:df:11 and 00-ba-d4-23-44-01. If the length of the address is not jND_EthernetAddress.ENET_ADDR_LEN an exception is thrown.

Parameters:
hex - - the string containing the address in hexadecimal.
Throws:
jND_Exception
